p: Based on the findings, naloxone (2 mg/kg) alone had no significant effects on both phases of formalin test (P>0.05). In addition, pretreatment with naloxone (2 mg/kg) significantly reversed antinociception by EOZC (20 mg/kg) in the first (58.50±3.77 s) and second (176.00±10.25 s) phases of formalin test (P<0.05) ( Figure 3).
